intro: Peristylus fallax, commonly known as the zigzag vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems that twist and turn as it grows. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are often clustered in loose inflorescences. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate to elliptical in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Peristylus fallax thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
